message.content: This question is asking about the effect of a substance absorbing solar energy. When a substance absorbs solar energy, it will experience a raising of warmth levels. This is because the absorbed energy is converted into heat, increasing the temperature of the substance. Option (B) is incorrect because absorbing solar energy would not cause heat levels to decrease. Option (C) is incorrect because the absorption of solar energy would result in an increase in temperature, not maintaining it. Option (D) is incorrect because the substance would not cool gradually if it is actively absorbing solar energy.

This question requires basic knowledge about the behavior of substances when exposed to solar energy. When a substance absorbs solar energy, it will experience an increase in warmth levels. This is because absorption of solar energy leads to the transfer of heat to the substance, causing its temperature to rise. Option (B) is incorrect because absorption of solar energy does not result in a decrease in heat levels. Option (C) is incorrect because there is no mention of the substance maintaining a specific temperature. Option (D) is incorrect because the substance will actually experience a rise in temperature when absorbing solar energy.

This question requires knowledge about the relationship between solar energy absorption and temperature change. When a substance absorbs solar energy, its warmth levels will increase. The absorbed solar energy will be converted into heat energy, causing the substance to become warmer. Option (B) is incorrect because if a substance is absorbing solar energy, its heat levels will not decrease exponentially. Option (C) is incorrect because absorbing solar energy will cause a temperature increase, not maintenance. Option (D) is incorrect because the substance will become warmer, not cooler.

Option (C) is incorrect because temperatures will not be maintained at a constant level when solar energy is absorbed.
